intro: Sabulina howellii, commonly known as Howell's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to arid environments and contribute to its ecological significance in its native range.
